++++ [[span style="font-variant: small-caps;"]]News Time Capsule[[/span]]
The dynamic nature of this wiki means that pages get moved, renamed, deleted, and replaced.
Wiki links on old news pages have been made non-functional as many no longer point to the same content. External links are unaffected.
[[/div]]


Welcome to this installment of site news, where we wish all you students best of luck in the new school year!

This is a series showing off news from the site, articles from the past month[[footnote]] with a rating above 0 [[/footnote]], and fan-content for you to check out and discover! Be sure to leave a comment with your thoughts!

++++ Featured Articles

* The featured articles for August were [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2779[[/a]] ("Oinkers") by Rimple, [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Stop going in circles[[/a]] by Tuomey Tombstone, and [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Recruitment Drive (R-28126)[[/a]] by tretter. The first is about a pig that //isn't// running Arch Linux, the second is about a failure to care, and the third is about the Factory's aggressive hiring practices. Check them out!

++++ Editor's Choice Articles

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3250[[/a]] ("Jesus Fried Chicken") - Rumor has it that on the third day Christ's body was in the cave... Colonel Sanders came out. By LilyFlower and minmin. //A fantastic work that starts with a relatively silly premise... and then pushes it: from absurd to hilarious to unsettling to horrific. However, the article never loses sight of the comedic core - both authors are aware that the Colonel is at the kernel of this piece, so to speak, and in keeping on eye on him and one on his chicken manage to straddle the line between comedy and horror. It's a thin, breaded line, and the dynamic duo do it with aplomb.//


++++ Event Featured Articles

The theme for the month of August was //crystalline//!

* In [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-1511[[/a]] ("Mobile Paradise"), by anqxyr, one man shattered the grand illusion...
* In [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-1083[[/a]] ("University Skull"), by Eskobar, the skull saw all...
* And in [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3637[[/a]] ("Many Waters Cannot Quench Love, Nor Can The Floods Drown It"), by Weryllium, a family persevered for millions of years...

++++ Rest of the News

* The [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Social Media Art Contest[[/a]] is over! We got dozens of fantastic submissions covering everything the Foundation had to offer!
* Staff promotions! Congratulations to DrMagnus, Leveritas, MrAnakinSpecter, Sly161, subtletea, and Zachary Maxwell on their promotions to Operational Staff, and congratulations to A Random Day for his promotion to moderator! To learn more about who they are and what they'll be doing, check out [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Meet the Staff[[/a]]!

Missing out on articles? Enjoy a recap on the articles from the past month.

+++ Week of August 1st:

Game on!

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3965[[/a]] ("Zhulong") - //SCP-3965 is a vaguely reptilian entity currently located on Mercury. The entity demonstrates morphological elements of Sphenodontidae, Xenodermatidae and Panthera, and is approximately 12km in length, with an average width of 50 meters.// Written by Anborough.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3341[[/a]] ("Arabian Nasnas a.k.a. Somali Hungruf") - The juvenile is a rabbit - the adult is a cyborg. Written by MrWrong.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3307[[/a]] ("Cornucopi-ass") - //SCP-3307 has no abnormal outward characteristics, and is physically healthy. However, when in the presence of any other human, SCP-3307 will begin to produce food or drink inside its body, which is expelled by vomiting or defecation.// Written by RecursiveRecursion.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3082[[/a]] ("Neverland's Lost Boys and Girls") - //Um… Would you believe me if I said I have magic plant powers?// Written by Rioludoodle.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3887[[/a]] ("Monster under the bed") - //Testing has shown that any substance or material presented to SCP-3887 so far is able to be used as sustenance, but it has shown a clear predilection for SCP-3887-A's socks.// Written by Noxfero.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3747[[/a]] ("Death by Vacuum") - IURC: Inter-Universal Relay Chat. Written by not_a_seagull.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-910[[/a]] ("Dust, Embodied") - //You're watchful, dutiful, and cold. You are the tomb of your old self.// Written by Pedantique.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3142[[/a]] ("If you can dream it, you can do it (as long as your dream is of being broke))" - //For generations, ██████'s work has captured the imaginations of Americans young and old, and we honor his memory with this coin's appropriately whimsical denomination of $i — the basis of imaginary numbers.// Written by Relevart.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3770[[/a]] ("One Thousand Footsteps Towards the Promised Land") - //Heartbeats, but not mine. I see something the sky- I thought it was a faint cloud at first but now some mist has cleared, I am relatively close to the planet Jupiter.// Written by Fingo7.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3146[[/a]] ("Money Match") - //SCP-3146 is a video game by the name of “Magical Hearts XX: Upgrade Ultimate ~EXTENSION~ DESTROYER Ascend!”.// Written by Tiefling.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3062[[/a]] ("The Lone and Level Sands Stretch Far Away") - //I tried to devour Mohammed. I found a sharp rock and tried to dig into his flesh. All that came out was sand.// Written by Sterbai.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3237[[/a]] ("A Man Who Is Not Cold") - //Two different temperatures have been recorded from SCP-3237: A consistent -34.8°C in the area roughly corresponding to SCP-3237's 'skin', and an inconsistent 400-600°C2 throughout the rest of SCP-3237's 'body', including exposed areas such as the eyes or inside of the mouth.// Written by Aeroxx1337.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-285[[/a]] ("A Hack Job") - //Holy Heck! You've just found yourself your very own Mr. Hax by Gamers Against Weed!// Written by BananaRepublic.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3102[[/a]] ("The Conflagration") - //When threatened, agitated, or heavily stressed, SCP-3102 will burst into flames.// Written by megalan.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-343-J[[/a]] ("Russell's Soup Can") - //Containment staff placed at DH-343 are to have scored at least a "Three-Alarm Habanero" on the Standard Dogmatic Spiciness Exam in either atheism or an Abrahamic faith.// Written by daveyoufool.

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Professors of Anart[[/a]] - Learn how to make anomalous art by channeling the flow of reality. Continued in [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Anart Lecture Caught inbetween a Dying Riverside Tree and a Discarded Campus Bench[[/a]], [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Foundation Mandated Interlude[[/a]], and [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Extracurricular Practice[[/a]]. All painted by SunnyClockwork.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]T Plus[[/a]] - In the long-awaited sequel to [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]T Minus[[/a]], learn the secrets of the [DATA EXPUNGED] incident that brought Prometheus Labs to its knees. Continued in [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Deus Vulture[[/a]], both written by A Random Day. 
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Conqueror Worm[[/a]] - Your God is a metafictional avatar channeling the power of an ancient space worm. Written by Ramona Vonnegut.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Kiefdust Crusaders[[/a]] - In the sequel to [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Bong Rip Tendency[[/a]], the members of GAW continue their battle against the members of AWCY?. Written by kinchtheknifeblade.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]She Remembered Me[[/a]] - //Now instead of an oversized birdcage he was held in a soundproof cell. His only audience was whoever was watching through the security camera.// Part of [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Dread and Circuses[[/a]], by DrChandra.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Torrent[[/a]] - What could you create if your art wasn't bound by the rules of this Earth? Written by Perelka_L.

++++ Hubs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Guns Pointed at the Head of God[[/a]] - In 1998, Prometheus Labs built a weapon to kill God. Twenty years later, it's become obsolete. This is the arms race of the new age. Built by A Random Day.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Dread and Circuses Hub[[/a]] - Herman Fuller may be gone, but the show must go on! Welcome to Herman Fuller's Circus of the Disquieting! Hosted by DrChandra. 

++++ Author's Pages

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Researcher Edward Flawrence's Personnel File[[/a]] - Flawed's author page!

+++ Week of August 8th:

Long ago, in a distant land...

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3996[[/a]] ("The Tangential Frontier") - //SCP-3996 was being ridden by a deceased corpse, believed to be the remains of a resident of Ghost Town who attempted to return to the prime dimension after an advanced period of time.// Written by Tufto.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2495[[/a]] ("The Well and the Pit") - //...there are ideas on both ends of the spectrum so far away from normal we can't fucking conceive of them without the aid of psychedelics and they spread even better than anything else.// Written by Taffeta.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3571[[/a]] ("OLLIE'S OBSTACLE COURSE OF OBVIOUS OBLITERATION!") - //Common names for courses have included “AMAZING ANDY'S ALLEY OF AWE!”, “CREEPY CARL'S CRAZY CRYPT OF CALAMITY!”, and “WACKY WILLY AND WILD BILL'S TRAPS OF TRULY TREACHEROUS TERROR!”// Written by 10DryDays.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3095[[/a]] ("Bird is the Word") - //SCP-3095-1 were first discovered in New York City, after an organized group made up of pigeons attempted to claim the Statue of Liberty for themselves.//
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3686[[/a]] ("Evan Deserves to be Remembered") - He didn't deserve what he got. He deserves what he'll be given. Written by DrMagnus.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-1512-EX[[/a]] ("3D Bioprinting") - //SCP-1512 are six (6) electro-mechanical devices, capable of artificially creating cellular matrices resembling functional human organs when provided with proper cellular material and growth media.// Written by Sad Xiao.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3187[[/a]] ("Honu") - Long ago, the Hawaiian peoples lived in harmony with the giant sea turtles. Then, everything changed when the Europeans invaded. Written by Chubert.

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Seas of Orcadia Part 1: How I Met Your Mither[[/a]] - The world is in danger, and it's up to the Sea Goddess's chosen princess to save it. But first she'll have to be woken up. Written by DrBleep.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Commentary on Selected Items in the Seimei Gallery[[/a]] - The Imperial Family has a long and storied tradition of receiving anomalous gifts from Japanese royals. [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]IJAMEA[[/a]] has other plans for it. Written by MrWrong.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Little Robot that Could[[/a]] - [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2785[[/a]] embarks on an epic quest in the middle of the apocalypse. Written by not_a_seagull.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Heroic Spirit Alexei Belitrov[[/a]] - //Because of that, he actually has nothing special that would normally make him a Heroic Spirit. However, since he happens to be the only soldier of his native universe to have survived a journey into another universe, that counts for something.// Written by MrWrong.

++++ Author's Pages

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Great Hippo[[/a]] - Being the author page of The Great Hippo!
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Agent Lily Flower's Personnel File[[/a]] - Being the author page slash communist manifesto of LilyFlower!
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Researcher Calvin's Personnel File[[/a]] - not_a_seagull's author page!

+++ Week of August 15th:

Have you tried turning it off and on again?

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-028-J[[/a]] ("PC Load Letter?!") - In the event of an XK-Class End-of-World Scenario, please see a network administrator. Written by DrMagnus.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3133[[/a]] ("An Email to O5-05") - The trolley problem never considered if you could switch places with the one person strapped to the track... Written by CannedBread.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3663[[/a]] ("The Adventure of the Cardboard Box") - //Following the event, two bodies of former personnel were recovered from within Site-54. Autopsies showed the cause of death was a buildup of paper residue/wood pulp in all major blood vessels, as well as sinuses, ear tubes, and the majority of the digestive and respiratory systems.// Written by MaliceAforethought.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3524[[/a]] ("You Cannot Contain Us") - //U źuty ich Isitoo worship Dr. ██████ █████ as U, and believe that one day, he will free them from containment, as well as destroy the entirety of SCP-3524, excluding themselves.// Written by taylor_itkin.

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Surprise! Happy Birthday! Listen closely, now...[[/a]] - Every year on Dr Gears' birthday, site members collaborate to create an anthology of short creepypasta. This year's selection comes from TheDuckman, Zyn, Roget, Doctor Cimmerian, Decibelles, shaggydredlocks, Taffeta, minmin, and more!
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Hector and Jacob[[/a]] - A man and an android have a conversation about ethics in the bowels of Robot Limbo. Written by Jacob Conwell.


+++ Week of August 22nd:

Gentlemen, we know that God is everywhere. We have also found where He is not...

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3710[[/a]] ("Elon MUSH!") - If you believe that, then I have an Iditarod to sell you... Written by DrBleep.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-076-J[[/a]] ("IN OWN WORDS") - If you ask Able, he's the best. You can't ask anyone else because Able killed them. Written by daveyoufool.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2693[[/a]] ("Transcendent Trial-and-error") - A close encounter of the seventh kind. Written by very_kelly.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-633[[/a]] ("Ghost in the Machine") - //Hello, I am the Ghost. Pleased to meet you, Researcher.// Written by Syka Bee, rewritten by Roget.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3064[[/a]] ("Hymn of Courage") - //SCP-3064-6 is notable for being the oldest known physical instance of SCP-3064 to exist, and demonstrates that SCP-3064 has been present in human culture since at least 1400 BCE.// Written by Tzuvembi.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]spikebrennan's proposal[[/a]] - //Bertrand, my assistant, puts it more bluntly: we’ve built a box and we’re pushing God out of it…// Chiseled by spikebrennan.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3171[[/a]] ("How the Foundation Came to Operate a Phone Sex Hotline") - Yeah, I bet you like spending time with your family, you dirty whore... Operated by ZoltanBerrigomo.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3079[[/a]] ("300 Tricks: Stage Magic Made Easy") - It will teach you 300 amazing tricks that really work, and 1 that really doesn't. Prepare to be amazed by The Great Hippo!
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3260[[/a]] ("10 Years Later") - Be the change you wish to see in the Foundation. Written by Jukse.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3525[[/a]] ("A 5-Star Lyft Driver") - This is not Cash Cab. Written by gishface.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3081[[/a]] ("H A N D M I L K ™") - //SCP-3081-1 are large organisms resembling human hands. SCP-3081-1 locomote using the thumb and index, ring and little fingers, while the middle finger acts as a head.// Written by TL333s.

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Ethics[[/a]] - The greater good is the greatest evil of all. Written by fieldstone.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]To Clean out a Night...[[/a]] - When you have to exorcise a [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]vengeful ghost[[/a]] nightly, you learn to appreciate what - and who - you have with you. Written by minmin.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Day the Clown Lived[[/a]] - When you do something wrong, people won't be sure you've done anything at all. Written by daveyoufool.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Fresh Hell[[/a]] - It's a hell of a first date for Adam Hutchinson and Marion Wheeler, in this prequel to the [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Antimemetics Division series[[/a]]. Written by qntm.

------

++++ Fandom Stuff

* Animator [https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCr6Ojg6WA9Lk-ynphZE9gtg Lord Bung] is creating cartoons based on the SCP Foundation! Start with [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v0b2s_ot9_0 Episode 1, featuring Fernand the Cannibal], move onto [http://www.scp-wiki.net/scp-407 Episode 2's Singing Forest], and top it off with [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oyUz6Ijl_wM Episode 3 and the inestimable adventures of Anderson!]

++++ Fanart

* Huge, huge thanks to Perelka_L, Zhange, and DrBleep for finding a ton of fantastic fan art from August!


* [https://sunnyclockwork.deviantart.com/art/SCP-3700-700465799 SunnyClockwork is back at it] with this depiction of the epic clash of titans from [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3700[[/a]] and a [https://twitter.com/SunnyClockwork/status/898142497649471488 striking, haunting contrast] between two men trapped in their own private hells.
* Zhange knocks it out of the park with [https://i.redd.it/twfvwag1d1iz.png an awe-inspiring portrayal] of //every single 001 Proposal// at once! Also be sure to check out her [https://i.redd.it/y92urzn9c4lz.png beautifully colored painting] of [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3007[[/a]]!
* ahbonjour is running [https://scpaesthetics.tumblr.com a unique art blog] that creates nine-image collages that capture the mood, style, and tone of various SCPs, characters, Groups of Interests, and more.
* Perelka_L hits us right in the feels with [https://twitter.com/Perelka_L/status/903021091089678336 a snapshot of the way the world ends]. Not with a bang, but a [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]whimper[[/a]].
* [https://twitter.com/equnam_e equnam_e] depicts [https://twitter.com/equnam_e/status/901761451173359621 a day in the life of Dr. Gears].
* [https://twitter.com/astrono77153462 astrono77153462] gives us a [https://twitter.com/astrono77153462/status/901402428456685570 glance through the doorway] of [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-1685[[/a]] and this [https://twitter.com/astrono77153462/status/899908749824937984/photo/1 terrifying glance into the hungry eyes] of [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-1155[[/a]].
* [https://twitter.com/sim_city1995 sim_city1995] shows us [https://twitter.com/sim_city1995/status/899673249381990400 a happy moment between Bright and a fellow researcher] as well as [https://twitter.com/sim_city1995/status/898162322341904385 a somber moment between two brothers].
* [https://twitter.com/paraparadiso paraparadiso] reminds us why Able is [https://twitter.com/paraparadiso/status/895911853779329025 our favorite murderous bishie]!
* Finish things off with [https://twitter.com/tsucchii_scp tsucchii_scp's] cute [https://twitter.com/tsucchii_scp/status/900976229364269056 GIF ] of an elemental golem from [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2300[[/a]]!


------

Thanks for tuning in again, folks! If you're unsatisfied with the blurb(s) provided for the article(s) you wrote, feel free to change it. Of course, you could just avoid that problem entirely by sending A Random Day a blurb for your article. We may or may not use it (if we can think of something more attention-getting, though we can try to stick with one you give us) but we'd really would just like them in order to make the process easier for making these. This is a community thing, and we want authors to give their blurbs to sell these articles much easier. It reduces the workload we have to do, and helps the news come out that much earlier!
